lines.text: To day to marry with my brothers daughter?

lines.speaker: Claud.
lines.text: Ile hold my minde were she an Ethiope.

lines.speaker: Leo.
lines.text: Call her forth brother, heres the Frier ready.

lines.speaker: Prin.
lines.text: Good morrow {% italic: Benedicke %}, why what's the matter?

lines.speaker: Prin.
lines.text: That you haue such a Februarie face,

lines.speaker: Prin.
lines.text: So full of frost, of storme, and clowdinesse.

lines.speaker: Claud.
lines.text: I thinke he thinkes vpon the sauage bull:

lines.speaker: Claud.
lines.text: Tush, feare not man, wee'll tip thy hornes with gold,

lines.speaker: Claud.
lines.text: And all Europa shall reioyce at thee,

lines.speaker: Claud.
lines.text: As once {% italic: Europa %} did at lusty {% italic: Ioue %},

lines.speaker: Claud.
lines.text: When he would play the noble beast in loue.

lines.speaker: Ben.
lines.text: Bull {% italic: Ioue %} sir, had an amiable low,

lines.speaker: Ben.
lines.text: And some such strange bull leapt your fathers Cow,

lines.speaker: Ben.
lines.text: A got a Calfe in that same noble feat,

lines.speaker: Ben.
lines.text: Much like to you, for you haue iust his bleat.

lines.speaker: Cla.
lines.text: For this I owe you: here comes other recknings.

lines.speaker: Cla.
lines.text: Which is the Lady I must seize vpon?

lines.speaker: Leo.
lines.text: This same is she, and I doe giue you her.

lines.speaker: Cla.
lines.text: Why then she's mine, sweet let me see your face.

lines.speaker: Leon.
lines.text: No that you shal not, till you take her hand,

lines.speaker: Leon.
lines.text: Before this Frier, and sweare to marry her.

lines.speaker: Clau.
lines.text: Giue me your hand before this holy Frier,

lines.speaker: Clau.
lines.text: I am your husband if you like of me.

lines.speaker: Hero.
lines.text: And when I liu'd I was your other wife,

lines.speaker: Hero.
lines.text: And when you lou'd, you were my other husband.

lines.speaker: Clau.
lines.text: Another {% italic: Hero? %}

lines.speaker: Hero.
lines.text: Nothing certainer.

lines.speaker: Hero.
lines.text: One {% italic: Hero %} died, but I doe liue,

lines.speaker: Hero.
lines.text: And surely as I liue, I am a maid.

lines.speaker: Prin.
lines.text: The former {% italic: Hero %}, {% italic: Hero %} that is dead.

lines.speaker: Leon.
lines.text: Shee died my Lord, but whiles her slander liu'd.

lines.speaker: Frier.
lines.text: All this amazement can I qualifie,

lines.speaker: Frier.
lines.text: When after that the holy rites are ended,

lines.speaker: Frier.
lines.text: Ile tell you largely of faire {% italic: Heroes %} death:

lines.speaker: Frier.
lines.text: Meane time let wonder seeme familiar,

lines.speaker: Frier.
lines.text: And to the chappell let vs presently.

lines.speaker: Ben.
lines.text: Soft and faire Frier, which is {% italic: Beatrice %}?

lines.speaker: Beat.
lines.text: I answer to that name, what is your will?

lines.speaker: Bene.
lines.text: Doe not you loue me?

lines.speaker: Beat.
lines.text: Why no, no more then reason.

lines.speaker: Bene.
lines.text: Why then your Vncle, and the Prince, & {% italic: Clau­ dio %}, haue beene deceiued, they swore you did.

lines.speaker: Beat.
lines.text: Doe not you loue mee?

lines.speaker: Bene.
lines.text: Troth no, no more then reason.

lines.speaker: Beat.
lines.text: Why then my Cosin {% italic: Margaret %} and {% italic: Vrsula %}

lines.speaker: Beat.
lines.text: Are much deceiu'd, for they did sweare you did.

lines.speaker: Bene.
lines.text: They swore you were almost sicke for me.

lines.speaker: Beat.
lines.text: They swore you were welȑnye dead for me.

lines.speaker: Bene.
lines.text: 'Tis no matter, then you doe not loue me?

lines.speaker: Beat.
lines.text: No truly, but in friendly recompence.

lines.speaker: Leon.
lines.text: Come Cosin, I am sure you loue the.

lines.speaker: Clau.
lines.text: And Ile be sworne vpon't, that he loues her,

lines.speaker: Clau.
lines.text: For heres a paper written in his hand,

lines.speaker: Clau.
lines.text: A halting sonnet of his owne pure braine,

lines.speaker: Clau.
lines.text: Fashioned to {% italic: Beatrice %}.

lines.speaker: Hero.
lines.text: And heeres another,

lines.speaker: Hero.
lines.text: Writ in my cosins hand, stolne from her pocket,

lines.speaker: Hero.
lines.text: Containing her affection vnto {% italic: Benedicke %}.

lines.text: A miracle, here's our owne hands against our

lines.speaker: Beat.

lines.speaker: Leon.
lines.text: Peace I will stop your mouth.

lines.speaker: Prin.
lines.text: How dost thou {% italic: Benedicke %} the married man?

lines.speaker: Bene.
lines.text: Ile tell thee what Prince: a Colledge of witteȑ {% italic: Claudio %}, I did thinke to haue beaten

lines.speaker: Cla.
lines.text: I had well hop'd y u wouldst haue denied {% italic: Beatrice %}, y t thou wilt be,

lines.speaker: Bene.
lines.text: Come, come, we are friends, let's haue a dance

lines.speaker: Leon.
lines.text: Wee'll haue dancing afterward.

lines.speaker: Bene.
lines.text: First, of my word, therfore play musick. {% italic: Prince %}, wife, get thee a wife, there is no

lines.speaker: Messen.
lines.text: My Lord, your brother Iohn is tane in flight,

lines.speaker: Messen.
lines.text: And brought with armed men backe to {% italic: Messina %}.

lines.speaker: Bene.
lines.text: Thinke not on him till to morrow, ile deuise {% italic: Dance %}.
